Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice with top of cul; white slip; interior: glazed (fired red-brown); part of floral pattern in added red above added white band; exterior: painted decoration consisting of couchant lion to left (chest, shoulder and foreleg with red, and part of underbelly remaining); part of elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the creature as possibly a sphinx, however, the scale pattern on the chest closely resembles that found on lions. For parallels, see British Museum 1888,0601.456. For the markings, see Lemos 1991, pls 26-27, no. 252 (BM GR 1888,0601.456); for the pose, pl. 58, no. 438 (BM GR 1888,0601.466a) and no. 439 (BM GR 1888,0601.466d, f, e).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p.252, no. 540)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0456) (phase 2)
